mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Welcomes his arrival in the U.S.; considers newspaper accounts of Short's "interventions between Bonaparte and me" unworthy of concern; will gladly be an agent for Short with the president, whose "dispositions to you are the best possible."
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1810 September 21, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to [William] Short, n.p.
